docs.snippet: The most vigorous measures have been inaugurated by the Government to correct the mistake of Sunday last, and to put the Army in a condition to make it impossible that such another event can occur.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Reported Settlement of the Diffficulty Between Spain and Hayti.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Marion, from Havana on the 18th inst., arrived at this port last night. She left at Havana the British screw frigate Jason and Spiteful. Sailed on the 15th, British screw sloop Racer. Sailed on the 12th, French brig-of-war Mercure, 18 guns, on a cruise Northward. Arrived on 18th,

docs.snippet: Patting together the accounts which reach us from all quarters, we are brought still more forcibly to the conclusion that the retirement of the National Army from before Manassas on Sunday, was in the face of victory, and not defeat. As our...
docs.lead_paragraph: Patting together the accounts which reach us from all quarters, we are brought still more forcibly to the conclusion that the retirement of the National Army from before Manassas on Sunday, was in the face of victory, and not defeat. As our dispatches continue to come in, they cut down the exaggerations of the first reports, and we now begin to have a more definite idea of what we have suffered.

headline.main: A REBEL VIEW OF GENERAL, JOHNSTON'S MOVEMENTS.

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; DEPARTURE OF THE FIRST NEW-YORK EXCELSIOR REGIMENT. SCENES AT THE ENCAMPMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The First Regiment of the Excelsior Brigade took their departure from Staten Island yesterday of ternoon. They received orders to march on Monday, and gave vent to their joy by exultant cheers. Everything was packed up on Monday evening, the tents being left behind for the use of the camp until the last regiments move. During the day the wives and daughters of the members came to bid adieu to their friends.
